docTitle.titlePart:
High laser damage threshold porous silica antireflective
coating

front.div:
A quarterwave-thick narrow-bandwidth antireflective coating for fused silica optical components and KDP
crystals has been developed. The coating consists of porous silica prepared from a silica sol in ethanol. It is
applied by dip or spin from a solution at room temperature and requires no further treatment. The laser
damage threshold levels are about equal to the surface damage thresholds of the uncoated substrates.
